title: Of All The Gifts Thy Love Bestows
author: William Cowper (1731-1800)
presentation: v1 v2 v3 v4 v5 v6 v7

v1: Of all the gifts Thy love bestows,
E'en heav'n itself no richer knows
v2: Faith, too, that trusts in Him through grace,
From that same love we gain;
Else, sweetly as it suits our case,
The gift had been in vain.
v3: O Love divine, Thou vast abyss!
From all debts we are free.
v4: In Jesus' blood our hearts can trace
And know the riches of Thy grace,
v5: Though heart may fail and flesh decay,
When earth and heav'n shall pass away,
v6: Until that day, we all confirm,
While here on earth, our utmost need,
v7: We praise Thee, and would praise Thee more,
To Thee our all we owe:
The precious Savior, and the pow'r
